QAPair.Question: What is (are) Minor burns - aftercare ?
QAPair.Answer: You can care for minor burns at home with simple first aid. There are different levels of burns . First-degree burns are only on the top layer of the skin. The skin can: Turn red, Swell, Be painful, Second-degree burns go one layer deeper than first-degree burns. The skin will: Blister, Turn red, Usually swell, Usually be painful, Treat a burn like a major burn (call your health care provider) if it is: From a fire, an electrical wire or socket, or chemicals, Larger than 2 inches (5 centimeters), On the hand, foot, face, groin, buttocks, hip, knee, ankle, shoulder, elbow, or wrist,
